availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Jefferson County
Greeting:

We command you to take John H. Caldwell, if he be found within your bailiwick, and him safely keep, so that you have his body before the Judge of the Lincoln Circuit Court, at the rules to be held in the clerk's office of said court, in the town of Stanford, on the fourth monday in June next, to satisfy the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of $50000/100 for a fine imposed on him, at the March term, 1861 for Permitting Faro Bank.
Also the sum of $525/100 which was adjudged to the said Commonwealth aforesaid, for her costs, in that behalf expended; and have then there this writ.
Wtiness S. S. McRoberts clerk of our said court, this 16th day ^of April^ 1864.

S. S. McRoberts C L. C C
for Jno J McRoberts D. C.

The above is a true copy
Thos Shanks DS for W A U S G C

The Commonealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Jefferson County- -
Greeting:

We command you that of the estate
of John H. Caldwell & J. W. Guest, late of your bailiwick, you cause to be made the sum of $514.17Â¢ with interest thereon at the rate of 6 percent. per annum, from the 1st day of July 1859 until paid, which The Commonwealth late in the Lincoln Circuit Court, recovered against them for debt due on R. bond also the sum of $200 which to said Commonwealth was adjudged for her costs in that behalf expended whereof the said John H. Caldwell & J. W. Guest are convicted as appears to us of record; and that you have said sums of money before the Judge of our said Court, at his office, in Stanford on the 4th Monday June next to render to said Commonwealth, the debt, interest, and costs aforesaid; and have then there this writ.
Witness S. S. McRoberts Clerk of said Court, this 16th day of April 1864

S. S. McRoberts, C. L. C. C.
for J. J. McRoberts, D. C.
On the foregoing is the following indorsement viz:

Memor.
This fifa issues on Repevin
Bond and no security to be taken

Att S. S. McRoberts clk
pr J. J. McRoberts D. C.

The Above is a true coppy
Thos Shanks D S for in a Ronald Shf

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
J. H. Caldwell
&
one
vs
Caldwell & Guest
Remit except fees & costs & enclose to Shff of Jefferson Co
